intro: Trichelostylis miliacea, commonly known as the broad-leafed sedge, is a perennial herb native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands, swamps, and other moisture-retentive environments. Its leaves are broad and flat, with a distinctive silver-green coloration on the underside. Trichelostylis miliacea plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
